step.context: \text{Which of the below function has the derivative}\\ \text{as } \sin nx - 4 \, e^{mx}\text{, where }n \in \mathbb{R}

step.tex:
\begin{align} \text{Since , }\dfrac{d \left(-\dfrac{\cos 2x}{2} - 4\,\dfrac{e^{3x}}{3}\right)}{dx} &= \sin 2x - 4 e^{3x}\\
\end{align}\\ \therefore \text{anti derivative or integral of }\sin 2x - 4 e^{3x}\text{ is} \\ -\dfrac{\cos 2x}{2} - 4 \,\dfrac{e^{3x}}{3}\\
